item.title: Jen add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "She consumed books like a whale eats krill." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"As I stood outside in Cow Lane, it occurred to me that Heaven must be a place where the library is open twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
No ... eight days a week." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Jen add a quote by Amy Sedaris
item.description: "I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are and to figure out why they are always alone." -- Amy Sedaris

item.title: Jen add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Jen add a quote by Peter Shaffer
item.description: "The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you." -- Peter Shaffer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jen add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "There is no place like home." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jen add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Love, n. A temporary insanity curable by marriage." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "If you remember nothing else, remember this: Inspiration from outside one's self is like the heat in an oven. It makes passable Bath buns. But inspiration from within is like a volcano: It changes the face of the world." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "You are unreliable, Flavia,' he said. 'Utterly unreliable.' Of course I was! It was one of the things I loved most about myself." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "There's a lot to be said for being alone. But you and I know, don't we, Flavia, that being alone and being lonely are not at all the same thing?" -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "I wish I could say I was afraid, but I wasn’t. Quite the contrary. This was by far the most interesting thing that had ever happened to me in my entire life" -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Experience has taught me that an expected answer is often better than the truth." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Susan Jane Gilman
item.description: "A girl doesn't need a guy in her life in order to act like a complete idiot. Certainly I, at least, never have." -- Susan Jane Gilman

item.title: Jen add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "It's true, isn't it, that each of us has two hearts? The secret heart, curled behind like a fist, living gnarled and shrunken beneath the plain, open one we use every day." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Jen add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "The simplest thing that can be said about any person, any relationship, is that it's not simple at all." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Jen add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "I wake up in that state of grief when you can tell you've been mourning even in your sleep." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Jen add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "I've always known that the best part of writing occurs before you've picked up a pen. When a story exists only in your mind, its potential is infinite; it's only when you start pinning words to paper that it becomes less than perfect. You have to make your choices, set your limits. Start whittling away at the cosmos, and don't stop until you've narrowed it down to a single, ordinary speck of dirt. And in the end, what you've made is not nearly as glorious as what you've thrown away." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Jen add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "Sometimes I wonder how we can be so sure what it is God sees. How arrogant we are, I sometimes think, to imagine there's someone watching us every minute. To think our every action matters that much." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Jen add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "There's no book that absolutely everyone loves." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Jen add a quote by Carolyn Parkhurst
item.description: "The conclusion I have reached is that, above all, dogs are witnesses." -- Carolyn Parkhurst

item.title: Jen add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "Chaos is the penance for leisure." -- Amy Tan

item.title: Jen add a quote by Susan Beth Pfeffer
item.description: "One of the more gratifying things about guilt is that it makes us feel important." -- Susan Beth Pfeffer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Anyone who knew the word slattern was worth cultivating as a friend." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "I gave her a partial smile and kept the rest of it for myself..." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Whenever I'm out-of-doors and find myself wanting to have a first-rate think, I fling myself down on my back, throw my arms and legs out so that I look like an asterisk, and gaze at the sky. " -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
Jen add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "I have to admit, though, that Cynthia was a great organizer, but then, so were the men with whips who got the pyramids built." -- Alan Bradley
